Name: Urban Legend: No-Escape Classroom
Description: Somewhere in the Academy, a mystery takes shape. A classroom that becomes a no-escape zone after class.... Is it truly as Mayo claimed? Gather your courage and go take a look!
QuestDesc: Somewhere in the Academy, a mystery takes shape. A classroom that becomes a no-escape zone after class.... Is it truly as Mayo claimed? Gather your courage and go take a look!

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hellooo, {PlayerName}…? You around Rabelle College right now?

Options.PlotLineKey: How do you know that? Are you actually psychic?
Nope, not there. Boo.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I wish! That would've been so cool to say. But... gotta be honest with a fellow fan club member. That's rule number one!

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And you're someone I'm working very hard to recruit, you know. Gotta stay completely honest!

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Pfft, no way I'm wrong. I'm an expert on the paranormal, you know. Maybe I do have a few... hidden talents.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …Wow, you're not playing along at all. Kuso. Was I that unconvincing?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, fine, truth time. Another member saw you there earlier. Figured you couldn't have gone far.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of which, there's a rumor going around Rabelle College. After class, when the whole campus goes quiet, the second classroom from the corridor becomes an inescapable zone...

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyone who goes in gets stuck, almost as if the room eats you. No matter what you do, you always wind up right where you started... staring at the same door.

Options.PlotLineKey: That sounds way too dramatic.
Seriously? What kind of B-grade urban legend is this…

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm just repeating what the survivor said. Flickering blue-white lights, a weird, staticky hum, and… a cursed, vengeful spirit.

Options.PlotLineKey: Is this a Sonoro incursion on campus?
Wait, but someone did get out, right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, but he said he was so scared he passed out. Woke up outside. No idea how he escaped.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe it really is some kind of inexplicable paranormal event. Or maybe there's a perfectly logical explanation waiting to be uncovered. Since you're this close... Come on, doesn't it pique your interest?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not saying you have to go, but it is one of the hottest topics in our club right now. Who knows, today might be the day you write your first legend.

Options.PlotLineKey: Fine, fine, you've sold me. I'll go check it out.
I'll check it out if I have time.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's the spirit, {PlayerName}!

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Go on, be brave! See for yourself what's really in there!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The second one from the corridor… Is this it? Looks like a normal classroom from the outside.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The moment you step inside, bright white lights snap on. The air freezes for a second, taking on a grainy quality.

Options.PlotLineKey: …Did the lights just turn on by themselves?

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Because this classroom… doesn't like the dark.
Too dark. I can't find my things… Come, come help me…

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A bitter voice whispers into your ear. You spin around and come face-to-face with a nearly transparent figure—

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A girl glowing with a faint, phosphorescent blue floats by your side.

Options.PlotLineKey: Who... No, what are you?
Well, there really is something weird here.

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Something weird? Hehe... Do. You. Mean. Me?
The one trapped here forever… Unless I find them again… Stay with me.

Options.PlotLineKey: I mean, the door's right there.

Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh… You mean the one behind you?
It's useless. That door… is temperamental. Unless I'm pleased.
Seems like you still don't understand what's happening… If you don't believe me, go ahead. See for yourself...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You explain the truth behind the "ghost" to Mayo.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... it was just a giant chain of misunderstandings?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Or someone was just too scared to face reality.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ha! Then that means… you've officially debunked another urban legend.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you know, urban legends… they sometimes grow back on their own.

Options.PlotLineKey: Then we'll just keep investigating them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly! Otherwise, what's the point of the Paranormal Fan Club?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Actually, Shion's story gave me an idea. I'm totally starting a forum series… "The Midnight Hologram Haunting." Catchy, right?

Options.PlotLineKey: Don't tell me you're out here creating urban legends yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shh! You shouldn't draw such a clear line between urban legends and the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...You're starting to sound like the real Mindbending Herder.

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Alright, alright! I'll post the real investigation results at the end. But we need a good hook to recruit new members, don't we?

Dialogues.Speaker: Mayo
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway, Mindbending Herder or whatever else comes up, if you run into another urban legend, just call me anytime!
Well? You tried it already? I told you, it's useless.
You can only leave if you please that "door."

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you the "door"?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, that's just a metaphor… My name is Shion. As expected, no one ever understands me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If only I were the door… A door doesn't need anyone. It doesn't care... It doesn't worry about being loved.

Options.PlotLineKey: Ugh, why are you suddenly so blue?
Then… how exactly am I supposed to please you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Bring them back… The feelings I poured into them… The things I gave them… The pieces of me I attached. Everything. Only then…

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only then will I be satisfied. Only then… can I leave.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And only then can you leave.

Options.PlotLineKey: Them? Feelings? Everything?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please, kind stranger. Help me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In this never-ending classroom… help me gather the three things that carry my feelings—

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My "gifts."

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, that's the one!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See? Someone does understand me, after all.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No… not this one. This isn't my gift!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I told you what I wanted!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No… not this one. This isn't my gift!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I told you what I wanted!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …I knew you would help me. Help me collect them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's no turning back now.

Options.PlotLineKey: So what are we looking for this time?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I hate things that look too clean and shiny. Pretty on the outside… but with a taste as cold as ice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But no one else felt the same except for him...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That afternoon, when I was so exhausted I nearly fainted, he was the one who gave me something that could actually warm me from the inside...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Steam fogged up my glasses. The broth was so rich and heavy. When he set it on the table, the smell filled the room… salty and savory.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He had to understand how I felt. So I started giving him the same thing, every single day. But then... why did he stop opening them?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He just put them aside… and said he'd share them with others!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He went too far, too far, TOO FAR!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Find it. Bring it back to me!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, that's it!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like… you're getting better at understanding me…

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, this isn't it… This isn't my gift…

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're so close…

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, this isn't it… This isn't my gift…

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're so close…

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well… this is the last one. Are you sure you want to?

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes. Tell me what you're looking for.
Go on! Just give it to me straight!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If that's how you feel… then I'll pull myself together. This time, I can definitely, absolutely move on!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You might not guess it, but I'm actually a musician. Even the coldest keys sound warm when I play them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even so, if he had asked, I would have given him the instrument that's been with me for years…

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He didn't say yes. But he didn't refuse either. He only told me—

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "This is really too heavy."

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No. Help me find it. My precious treasure with black-and-white keys. I'm not leaving it with someone like that!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, this isn't it… This isn't my gift…

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're so close…

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, this isn't it… This isn't my gift…

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're so close…

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They're all back... all of my "gifts"... But what about my feelings?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My feelings for him... Could I...? No, I can't. If I put them back...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If he saw them, maybe he'd remember me. Maybe he'd change his mind…

Options.PlotLineKey: You took them back, and now you want to give them again?
Isn't that just going in circles?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sure, the things you gave were a little… unusual. But someone who really liked you would get your vibe, no matter how strange.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And someone who truly cared wouldn't blow hot and cold like that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The girl freezes at your words. The blue glow around her sharpens. You glance at a nearby data interface and decide to call her bluff.

Options.PlotLineKey: You're just a projection, aren't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Eh? Y-you noticed…

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Strictly speaking, yes. I'm not really here. It's just a little trick with holographic tech.

Options.PlotLineKey: Then why the whole spooky ghost act?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I didn't mean to scare anyone! I just… I just couldn't bring myself to come in person, so I gambled that someone brave might help me.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why someone brave?
Why didn't you dare to come yourself?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For one, I really, really don't want that guy to see me... skulking around to take back my gifts. Just thinking about it is mortifying!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If-if he asked me why, or tried to say hi, I couldn't just pretend I don't know him… I just haven't figured out how to face him yet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And also, the Mindbending Herder is terrifying.

Options.PlotLineKey: The Mindbending Herder?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You don't know her?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She never makes a sound. She just walks through empty classrooms, hunting down lone students.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She puts a curse on them and feeds them to this... this thing she summoned! If you're still inside a classroom, you'll be eaten whole!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I don't want to be her next target. And also… Shh—listen!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thump... thump... Creak—CREAK— Footsteps! And... and chewing! It's her! The Mindbending Herder is here!

Options.PlotLineKey: Shion, don't scare yourself—

Dialogues.Speaker: Zahira
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The moment your eyes meet, she looks a bit surprised to find you here.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Zahira
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Then she raises her hand, tracing slow circles in the air, as though weaving an obscure spell. The space around her shimmers faintly.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I KNEW IT! It's a real curse! I'm done for!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Should I cut the projection? B-but you helped me… I can't just leave you alone here…

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Calm down, Shion. This is Zahira, my friend. And that's not a curse. It's just her Forte.

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: …What?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She can't speak, so her Forte works a bit differently. This is all a misunderstanding.

Dialogues.Speaker: Zahira
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (She puffs her cheeks slightly, as if annoyed at being misunderstood.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A m-misunderstanding?

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So the rumors were wrong… and I mistook a good person for an urban legend?

Dialogues.Speaker: Zahira
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (She crosses her arms, pretending to be angry, and nods.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm sorry—!

Dialogues.Speaker: Zahira
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Seeing how genuinely contrite Shion is, she sighs and gently pats her shoulder.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't be so nice all of a sudden! You'll make my heart skip a beat!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I fall in love at the drop of a hat, okay?! And I just got my feelings back, so I'm emotionally vulnerable right now...

Options.PlotLineKey: Shion, you…
You were terrified a second ago!

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Girl stuff. You wouldn't understand...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So that's how it is. You got so scared of the Mindbending Herder that you ended up becoming an urban legend yourself, creating a real one...

Dialogues.Speaker: Shion
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What? You mean me?

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah, the "ghost" trapping people in an inescapable classroom.
